title: Khosrow-Yazdegerd
text: Khosrow-Yazdegerd was a 5th-century statesman in <a href="Sasanian%20Empire">Sasanian Iran</a>, who was active during the reign of <a href="shah">shah</a> <a href="Yazdegerd%20I">Yazdegerd I</a> (r. 399-421). He first appears in 410, when he was sent with Mihr-Shapur as the shah's representative to the <a href="Church%20of%20the%20East">Nestorian</a> <a href="Council%20of%20Seleucia-Ctesiphon">Council of Seleucia-Ctesiphon</a>. Khosrow-Yazdegerd is the second person known to occupy the office of "<a href="wuzurg%20framadar">wuzurg framadar</a>" (grand vizier) after <a href="Abarsam">Abarsam</a>, who was active under <a href="Ardashir%20I">Ardashir I</a> (r. 224-242). He was most likely succeeded by <a href="Mihr%20Narseh">Mihr Narseh</a>.
